result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:49 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan M Huizar-Campos in court.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Juan M Huizar-Campos. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. Interpreter, Dawn Maldonado, appeared on behalf of the defendant. Defense request jury trial and final pre-trial. 
BTC: Matter set for trial and final pre-trial. All pre-trial motions to be filed to final pre-trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 7, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

Racine County Alternatives Program- Progress Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with the victim A. T(person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
AMENDED 06/28/22 DEFENDANT MAY HAVE NON VIOLENT CONTACT WITH VICTIM

9:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Juan M Huizar-Campos in court.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Juan M Huizar-Campos. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. Interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez. Sworn in.
Defense has filed a bond motion, requesting a no contact order be lifted.
 Motion was filed by the alleged victim. Victim is not present in the hearing room. 
State objects to modification, noting victims written statement verbiage. 
BTC: Bond motion granted, court will allow non violent contact with victim.

Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with the victim A. T(person, property, residence or family). Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
